title: Requires inmates to be evaluated and treated for alcoholism and drug abuse
summary: Requires inmates to be evaluated and treated for alcoholism and drug abuse.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2491

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 19, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. MENG -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Alcoholism and Drug Abuse

       AN ACT to amend the mental  hygiene  law  and  the  correction  law,  in
         relation to alcohol and substance abuse treatment programs for inmates

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The mental hygiene law is amended by adding a  new  section
    2  22.13 to read as follows:
    3  S 22.13 EVALUATION  AND TREATMENT OF PERSONS COMMITTED TO THE CUSTODY OF
    4            THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONAL SERVICES.
    5    PERSONS COMMITTED TO THE CUSTODY OF  THE  DEPARTMENT  OF  CORRECTIONAL
    6  SERVICES  UNDER AN INDETERMINATE OR DETERMINATE SENTENCE OF IMPRISONMENT
    7  SHALL BE EVALUATED AND TREATED FOR ALCOHOL AND SUBSTANCE  ABUSE  DEPEND-
    8  ENCE  PROBLEMS  BY  PERSONS  WHO  ARE CREDENTIALED ALCOHOL AND SUBSTANCE
    9  ABUSE COUNSELORS BY THE OFFICE. SUCH EVALUATION AND  TREATMENT  PROGRAMS
   10  SHALL  BE DEVELOPED IN COLLABORATION WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONAL
   11  SERVICES.
   12    S 2. Subdivision  17 of section 2 of the correction law, as  added  by
   13  chapter 338 of the laws of 1989, is amended to read as follows:
   14    17. "Alcohol and substance abuse treatment [facility] PROGRAM."  (A) A
   15  correctional  [facility]  PROGRAM  designed  [to  house  medium security
   16  inmates as defined by department rules and regulations and operated] for
   17  the purpose of providing intensive alcohol and substance abuse treatment
   18  services TO INMATES  OF  THE  DEPARTMENT.  Such  services  shall  ensure
   19  comprehensive  treatment  for alcoholism and substance abuse PURSUANT TO
   20  PARAGRAPH (B) OF THIS SUBDIVISION to ALL inmates UNDER  THE  CUSTODY  OF
   21  THE  DEPARTMENT  who  have been identified by the commissioner or his or
   22  her designee, A COURT AT THE TIME SENTENCE IS IMPOSED, OR  BY  A  PERSON
   23  WHO  IS  A  CREDENTIALED  ALCOHOL  AND  SUBSTANCE ABUSE COUNSELOR BY THE
   24  OFFICE OF ALCOHOL AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE SERVICES, as having had  or  pres-
   25  ently having a history of alcoholism or substance abuse.  SUCH TREATMENT

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05569-01-1

       A. 2491                             2

    1  PROGRAM  SHALL BE DEVELOPED IN COLLABORATION WITH THE OFFICE OF ALCOHOL-
    2  ISM AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE SERVICES. Such services shall  be  provided  [in
    3  the  facility  in  accordance  with minimum standards promulgated by the
    4  department  after consultation with the division of alcoholism and alco-
    5  hol abuse and the division  of  substance  abuse  services]  WITHIN  THE
    6  DEPARTMENT  BY  PERSONS WHO ARE CREDENTIALED BY THE OFFICE OF ALCOHOLISM
    7  AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE SERVICES, AND SHALL BE PROVIDED IN  ACCORDANCE  WITH
    8  MINIMUM  STANDARDS ESTABLISHED BY REGULATION BY THE OFFICE OF ALCOHOLISM
    9  AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE SERVICES.
   10    (B) THE DEPARTMENT SHALL ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH RULES AND  REGULATIONS
   11  OF  THE  OFFICE  OF  ALCOHOLISM  AND  SUBSTANCE ABUSE SERVICES AND SHALL
   12  REQUIRE THAT INMATES WHO ARE RELEASED ON PAROLE, CONDITIONAL RELEASE  OR
   13  POST-RELEASE  SUPERVISION  AND  WHO ARE, AS A CONDITION OF SUCH RELEASE,
   14  REQUIRED TO PARTICIPATE IN TREATMENT AND INMATES WHO ARE TRANSFERRED  TO
   15  A  COMMUNITY-BASED  TREATMENT  PROGRAM  IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE COMMUNITY
   16  REINTEGRATION PHASE OF THE COMPREHENSIVE  ALCOHOL  AND  SUBSTANCE  ABUSE
   17  TREATMENT  PROGRAM,  SHALL  BE PROVIDED WITH A SUBSTANCE ABUSE TREATMENT
   18  ASSESSMENT BY A PERSON WHO IS A CREDENTIALED ALCOHOL AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE
   19  COUNSELOR AND COMMUNITY-BASED  ALCOHOL  AND  SUBSTANCE  ABUSE  TREATMENT
   20  SERVICES  PROVIDING  AN  APPROPRIATE  CONTINUUM  OF CARE AND DESIGNED TO
   21  REDUCE OFFENDER RECIDIVISM AND CRIME.
   22    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   23  it shall have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the mental hygiene law and the correction law, in relation to alcohol and substance abuse treatment programs for inmates
